text: The role of <extra_id_0> BSAP <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ( <extra_id_0> Pax-5 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ) in B-cell development .
The hierarchy of transcriptional control in B-cell development has recently been analyzed by targeted gene inactivation in the mouse .

In this manner , the paired box containing gene <extra_id_0> Pax-5 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , encoding the <extra_id_0> B cell specific transcription factor <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> <extra_id_0> BSAP <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , has been shown to play a key role in early B lymphopoiesis .

Other experimental strategies have implicated <extra_id_0> BSAP <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> in the control of cell proliferation , isotype switching and transcription of the immunoglobulin heavy-chain gene at late stages of B-cell differentiation .
